stimulusHtml: The government of Olympia is considering a fiscal policy action to slow the economy and curb inflation. If the marginal propensity to consume is 0.8, which of the following responses correctly identifies a policy action that would help the government achieve its goals and the impact of that action on Olympiaâ€™s real gross domestic product (GDP)?
choicesHtml: Increasing taxes by $10 billion increases real GDP by a maximum of $50 billion.
Decreasing taxes by $10 billion decreases real GDP by a maximum of $50 billion.
Increasing taxes by $10 billion increases real GDP by a maximum of $40 billion.
Increasing government spending by $10 billion increases real GDP by a maximum of $50 billion.
Decreasing government spending by $10 billion decreases real GDP by a maximum of $50 billion.
